text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This revision includes the following significant changes:

IRM Reference Description of Change IRM 8.1.6.3.1 (7) Renumbered paragraph (5) to paragraph (7) accordingly and updated the Step/Action table as follows: 1. Step 1 - included the new toll-free phone numbers 2. Step 2 - added the nine-digit OPI pin requirement 3. Step 3 - included a list of prompts for 9 language options 4. Step 4 - removed because it no longer applies 5. Step 5 - renumbered to Step 4 6. Step 6 - renumbered to Step 5 7. Step 7 - removed because it no longer applies IRM 8.1.6.3.1 (8) Renumbered paragraph (6) to paragraph (8) accordingly.

) Tax returns and related data are open to inspection by a United States Attorney or an attorney of the Department of Justice only if they file a written application. See IRM

, Disclosure of Official Information to Agencies for Administration of Non-Tax Criminal Laws. This procedure also applies to other Justice Department employees such as Federal Bureau of vestigation agents. An application is unnecessary in a tax case that has referred to the Department of Justice for prosecution, suit or defense. An cation signed by the Chief of the Organized Crime and Racketeering does not meet the requirements. (

) Taxpayers have the right to retain an authorized representative of their to represent them in their dealings with the IRS. Taxpayers have the right to Certified seek assistance from a Low Income Taxpayer Clinic if they cannot afford Accountants, sentation, as described in Publication
, Your Rights as a Taxpayer. Limited (

) Practice before the IRS includes all matters connected with a presentation and Special the IRS relating to a client’s rights, privileges, or liabilities under laws or tions administered by the IRS. Such presentations include preparing and necessary documents, corresponding and communicating with the IRS, and representing a client at conferences, hearings, and meetings. An individual who practices is a representative. In order for the IRS to recognize an indi- vidual as a representative, he or she must present evidence of representational authority. (
) The following publications and forms are useful sources of information con- cerning practice before the IRS and powers of attorney. a. Treasury Department Circular No.

) In the event an authorized representative is not evident from the case file, ATE should make an effort to identify the authorized representative either contacting the taxpayer, researching IDRS for a Centralized Authorization (CAF) number via command code CFINK, or by any other means deemed propriate. Special care should be taken to ensure that the rules of as discussed in IRM
, Disclosure of Official Information, are not violated when identifying an authorized representative.

In the event an authorized representative is not evident from the case file, ATE should make an effort to identify the authorized representative either contacting the taxpayer, researching IDRS for a Centralized Authorization (CAF) number via command code CFINK, or by any other means deemed propriate. Special care should be taken to ensure that the rules of as discussed in IRM
, Disclosure of Official Information, are not violated when identifying an authorized representative. While other statements can be used, Form

, Power of Attorney and ration of Representative, is convenient. a. The form has declarations as to current qualifications. b. The form authorizes disclosures of information of a confidential nature. c. The form provides optional authorizations to perform various other acts the taxpayer.

The form has declarations as to current qualifications. The form authorizes disclosures of information of a confidential nature. The form provides optional authorizations to perform various other acts for the taxpayer.

) When a third party contact is made, complete Form
, Third Party Report Form and fax it to Philadelphia APS. Follow the instructions for com- party contacts pleting the Form
The form is available on ACDS and the Multimedia to Appeals Publishing Web page. a. For Trust Fund Recovery Penalty investigations, a separate Form
must be completed for the business and each potentially responsible person. Use MFT

for the potentially responsible person and the business tax periods that would be included in the assessment. b. Multiple contacts with the same third party, on different dates, require a separate Form
for each contact. c. Multiple contacts with the same third party, on the same day by the employee, requires only one Form
) Philadelphia APS maintains the third party database for Appeals. See IRM
, Third Party Database Maintenance. (
) IRC

), Notice of specific contacts, requires the Service to provide a list of third party contacts when requested by the taxpayer. The ATE will be responsible for providing a list of third party contacts to the taxpayer. This differs from IRM
, Area/Campus TPC Coordinators and Input Personnel in that the TPC and/or Input Personnel are responsible for the
and Letter

, Third Party Contacts. a. The ATE who receives the request must immediately fax a request to Philadelphia APS, which includes the taxpayer’s name, address, and Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN). The fax number is (
) b. Philadelphia APS will use IDRS Command code TPCOL to generate the list and return it to the ATE by fax or email. c. The ATE will prepare Letter
(address per the taxpayer or Master to transmit the third party contacts to the taxpayer within two business days of the request. Letter
must include a list of third party made after January

, or made since the taxpayer received the latest periodic report of contacts. Note: ATE should not accept a blanket request for future third party contacts. Taxpayers must submit a separate request for each list of their third party contacts .

and Outside Contacts
) Executive Order

, Improving Access to Services for Persons with English Proficiency, requires all federal agencies to: a. Examine the services they provide, b. Identify needs for services to those with limited English proficiency and c. Develop and implement a system that ensures meaningful access to necessary services for LEP persons (
) Guidelines and procedures for implementing the requirements of Executive Order
are in IRM
, IRS Language Services. (
) Other useful information is available on the .Appeals Multi-Language web page (
) Effective August

, the IRS transitioned to Lionbridge, to provide over- the-phone interpreter (OPI) service. The Lionbridge OPI service provides interpretation assistance that helps employees talk with taxpayers who have limited proficiency with the English language and offers a quick, easy and efficient way to communicate with taxpayers through translators who speak any of more than
different languages. The Lionbridge OPI service is to taxpayers and available
hours per day to all Appeals employees who have contact with taxpayers. (
) Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR)
, Privacy Act, requires the vendor/contractor to “Comply with the Privacy Act of

(the Act) and the agency rules and regulations issued under the Act.” All employees of the vendor/contractor are bound under the performance of the contract with IRS comply with and assume responsibilities under the Disclosure of Information safeguards. (
) The following resources are available to assist you with using the Lionbridge (OPI) service: (cid:
) Lionbridge Pocket Guide (cid:
) Lionbridge Telephonic User Guide (
) You will need the following pieces of information to access the OPI service: (cid:
) Toll-free phone number
(or toll-free back up phone
) (cid:
) Your nine-digit pin # which is comprised of the
digit telephonic ID for site followed by your unique
digit user pin (
) If you have misplaced your Lionbridge pin or need to request a new pin, visit the Appeals Multi-Language Strategy web page for the point of contact information. (
) The list below provides tips for using OPI services: (cid:
) Speak in “first person” (as though you’re talking directly to the taxpayer) (cid:
) Use short sentences (cid:
) Ask only one question at a time (cid:
) “Word for word” interpretation is often limited (cid:
) Avoid using acronyms (
) The following table contains the steps for using the OPI service: Internal Revenue Manual
Security and Outside Contacts 8.1.6 page 5

Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 52.224-2, Privacy Act, requires the OPI vendor/contractor to “Comply with the Privacy Act of 1974 (the Act) and the agency rules and regulations issued under the Act.” All employees of the OPI vendor/contractor are bound under the performance of the contract with IRS comply with and assume responsibilities under the Disclosure of Information
The following table contains the steps for using the OPI service:

8.1 Appeals Step Action 1 Dial 1-888-563-1155 (888-563-3922 is the back up phone number) 2 At the prompt, enter your unique nine-digit OPI PIN: Example: 5150-22178 3 At the prompt, enter the designated language code digit: (cid:129) 1 for Spanish (cid:129) 2 for Creole (cid:129) 3 for Mandarin (cid:129) 4 for Korean (cid:129) 5 for Vietnamese (cid:129) 6 for Somali (cid:129) 7 for Russian (cid:129) 8 for French (cid:129) 9 for Arabic (cid:129) 0 for any other language needs or concerns (see Note below) Note: If you don’t know the name of the language, stay on the line and an OPI representative will help you. 4 An OPI services representative will come on the line and ask for your Standard Employer Identifier (SEID) (remember to speak your SEID slowly and clearly) 5 a. Brief the interpreter on the general purpose of the call. Example: “This will be my first discussion with the taxpayer, so I want to make sure she under- stands the Appeals process and the general elements of innocent spouse relief.” b. Summarize what you wish to accomplish. Example: “I want to make sure I understand the tax- payer’s concerns and I will also explain the verification items I need from her.” c. Give the interpreter any special instructions. Example: “I am going to be talking about payment options and specifically a Direct Debit Install- ment Agreement, through which the taxpayer’s monthly payments are drawn directly from his bank account.” (8) Use Form 14162, OPI Service Feedback, to provide feedback or report any

Use Form 14162, OPI Service Feedback, to provide feedback or report any problems encountered while using the OPI service. The form has a self- emailing feature that submits it directly to *W&I M&P OPI.
